page.title: 02Farming around Eryrys
page.content: {Upland farming.} This upland area around Eryrys is dominated by Nercwys Mountain which is covered with coniferous trees. Other land around is uncultivated, often because of its steepness with limestone outcrops facing east and west. However some land has been reclaimed. Sheep are the main feature of the farming, grazing on small, irregular fields bounded by stone walls and hedges. They are also found on fenced heathland. The breeds of sheep are Welsh ewes and Suffolk rams. Two small herds of dairy and store cattle and one goat herd can also be found in this area. There is one small field of corn and one of winter kale. The houses of the fairly small farms have been modernised quite recently.
